subject: Re: [junit] [PATCH] filter stack traces in junit
msgSnippet: Ben Maurer wrote:  I m in a code-reviewing mood, so don t mind me. There are just suggestions. ... Why not just new
messageBody:
Ben Maurer wrote:
<snip />

I'm in a code-reviewing mood, so don't mind me. There are just suggestions.

> + List<StackTraceElement> filtered = new
> ArrayList<StackTraceElement> ();
> + for (StackTraceElement ele : trace)
> + filtered.add (ele);

Why not just

new ArrayList<StackTraceElement>(Arrays.asList(trace))

here? (Add the necessary types to make that proper Java 5.0. I don't
speak parameterized types.)

> + return filtered.toArray (new StackTraceElement [] {});

new StackTraceElement[0]
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info

JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
